cyclone.name: LIDIA
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles SSE of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking north-northwest across Baja California Sur on Thursday–Friday, then turning northwest and weakening over the Pacific well southwest of the U.S.-Mexico border
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cabo San Lucas, southern Baja California peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Baja California Sur from Puerto Cortes to east of La Paz; Tropical Storm Watch: Baja California Sur north of San Evaristo to Loreto and north of Puerto Cortes to Puerto San Andresito
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning: Baja California Sur from Puerto Cortes to San Evaristo and mainland Mexico from Bahia Tempehuaya to Huatabampito
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South-west mainland Mexico and most of Baja California Sur
weather_observation.wind: Only a very low (≤3%) chance of tropical-storm-force gusts reaching the port late this weekend or early next week; prevailing winds expected to remain below gale force.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of light showers possible early next week, but heavy rainfall is not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period southerly swells generated by Lidia may reach Southern California beaches this weekend, increasing surf and rip-current risk and complicating small-craft operations.
